com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.gestures

Class OverlayPreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.gestures.OverlayPreferences

  • public class OverlayPreferences
extends java.lang.Object

    The Overlay Preferences class is used to set the Overlay display preferences. This sets the desired visual feedback to be displayed to the user.

    After an OverlayPreferences object is modified, the GestureDeviceManager's GestureDeviceManager.setOverlayPreferences(OverlayPreferences) must be called with the GestureDeviceManager instance to update the behavior.

    The default preferences is set as enabled and configured to display all arrow icons: left, right, up, and down as well as engagement icon.

    Usage Examples

    Default: Show All
    OverlayPreferences();

    Hide Overlay
    OverlayPreferences(false, 0);

    Show Left and Right Icons Only
    OverlayPreferences(true, LEFT | RIGHT);

    Show Up, Down, Engagement
    OverlayPreferences(true, UP | DOWN | ENGAGEMENT);

    The following is the default Overlay. In this example, an engagement event of 100% confidence has been detected.

    Overlay Behavior

    The Overlay Behavior is dependent on the gesture mode.

    If the gesture mode does not support a particular swipe but it is turned on, the animation for that swipe will not be displayed. For example, if GestureMode.NEAR_GESTURE is the selected gesture mode and Left, Right, Up, Down, and Engagement are all turned on, the only arrows the Overlay can display is left or right. This is because the mode can only detect left or right swipes so the other arrow displays is never triggered.

    When in GestureMode.ENGAGEMENT_GESTURE mode, the white arrows will not be displayed until the engagement confidence is 100%.

    When a swipe is detected, visual feedback is given to the user. The overlay will automatically disappear after a short period of time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OverlayPreferences

        public OverlayPreferences()
        Instantiates a new overlay preferences. All visual indicators will be shown. The overlay is enabled by default.

      • OverlayPreferences

        public OverlayPreferences(boolean enabled,
                  int flags)
        Instantiates a new overlay preferences. 
         
 Examples:
 
 OverlayPreferences(false, 0); // hide overlay
 OverlayPreferences(true, LEFT | RIGHT); // show only left and right arrows
 OverlayPreferences(true, UP | DOWN | ENGAGEMENT); // show up, down, engagement
        Parameters:
        enabled - Flag to indicate whether overlay is enabled or not.
        flags - The bitmask for which visual indicators are visible. See example.

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled field. Set to false to hide the overlay. Set to true to show the overlay.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Flag to indicate whether overlay is enabled or not.

        Update the overlay preferences.
        Parameters:

        flags - The bitmask for which visual indicators are visible. See example.
